meanings.definition: A building material consisting of a layer of plaster sandwiched between two layers of paper.
meanings.sent1: The construction worker carried a heavy sheet of plasterboard to the building site.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the new house were made of plasterboard for easy installation.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the plasterboard, it created a paper avalanche in the room.
meanings.sent4: The plasterboard acted as a protective shield, shielding the room from noise.
meanings.sent5: The plasterboard, like a sturdy sandwich, held the room together with its paper layers.

meanings.definition: To cover or decorate with plasterboard.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will plasterboard the ceiling to give it a smooth finish.
meanings.sent2: She decided to plasterboard the entire room to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The kids joked that they would plasterboard the treehouse for a fancy touch.
meanings.sent4: He plasterboarded the stage, transforming it into a blank canvas for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The artist planned to plasterboard the gallery walls for an unconventional exhibition.
